content.prompt:
Consider the following class definition. The class does not compile.

public class Player

{

private double score;

public getScore()

{

return score;

}

// Constructor not shown

}

The accessor method getScore is intended to return the score of a Player object. Which of the following best explains why the class does not compile?

choices.label: The getScore method should be declared as private.
The getScore method requires a parameter.
The return type of the getScore method needs to be defined as double.
The return type of the getScore method needs to be defined as void.

skill.text: 3.D: Explain why a code segment will not compile or work as intended and modify the code to correct the error.
